snippet: A dream to take part in an American rite of passage came true for girls whose faith forbids them to date or dance with boys.
abstract: Hamtramck High School in Michigan holds its first all-girl prom, which conforms to Muslim religious beliefs forbidding dating, dancing with boys or appearing without a head scarf in front of males; survey found 65 percent of girls at the school were not able to attend the coed prom because of cultural and religious beliefs, so the school supported the student-driven alternative. Photos, Map (M)
lead_paragraph: HAMTRAMCK, Mich. -- The prom countdown was nearly complete, the do-it-yourself Greek columns, pink and white tulle bows and plastic flutes with the ''Once Upon a Dream'' logo awaiting the evening of evenings. But as she looked at her reflection in the mirror, her one-shoulder lavender gown matching the elaborate hijab that framed her face in a cascade of flowers -- a style learned on YouTube -- Tharima Ahmed knew that what lay ahead was more than simply a prom.

headline.main: Michigan School's Alternative Prom Has Everything Except the Boys
